comment: Not a fan. Her guidelines can be unclear and does not clarify when someone asks about it. Then, she gives gives harsh grades and takes points off for the most minor details. Mainly because she does not address any confusion or unclear criteria. She's out of touch with students and doesn't communicate well for someone who teaches communications.
I did not like her personality, class, and style of teaching at all. She grades assignments harshly. She is a very patronizing person. I'd recommend avoiding her if possible.

not sure if she's just not great online, but I took her in person and really enjoyed the class. I found it fairly easy as long as you applied yourself and took lecture notes. She was pretty engaging and would do reviews before a test. Lots of quizzes and discussion posts, but nothing that hard.
Not a helpful teacher! Do not recommend.

Professor Madison is an extremely frustrating professor. She is lazy, has random assignments missing, and incorrect answers on quizzes/tests. I had to email her at least once a week for the first four weeks of class because of this. She also said incorrect information in class before, and does not put effort into her lectures. Do NOT take her.

I took her for Mass Comm. Her lectures are sometimes interesting, but I never really had much desire to show up to class. She was nice, but was extremely hard to contact. Will not budge if you miss a deadline. The class D2L got kind of unorganized towards the end- lots of assignments due on random days. Overall, I would take again.

Professor Madison is just not a good professor. I dropped her class because of the workload and how lazy she was. You feel like you're in 4th grade doing fill in the blanks of a textbook. She uses other teachers lecture videos and her tests are not multiple choice. Honestly will never take her again. She is also very rude on emails and not clear.

Carmen Madison is one of the laziest professors I have ever taken at KSU. I took her class online, and she did not make the lectures or most material. She used other professor's works. She closes the modules so if you want to look back at a lecture to study, YOU CAN'T. No access to the content you paid for. STAY AWAY!

I took MENT 3200 this pass spring and it was okay. I wouldn't take her again because she doesn't get back with you on emails  and doesn't really have an open mind set .It's her way or the high way type of grading.If you ask her should I drop the class and she say back "I would never recommend that to a student".She will fail you.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Really good teacher. Grades tough but does a lot to help you get better in terms of feedback and provides lots of information
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Madison has been one of the best professors I have had at KSU. She is super inspiring and cares a lot about her students. She gives assignment details in advance so you can work on them over a long period of time. She works for the success of her students and challenged us with in-class discussions. She is a true gem, take her!

I'm not really a fan of Professor Madison simply because she doesn't explain her assignments well enough or her grading criteria, especially for big assignments. She's also a super tough grader and will take points off for the smallest things. Also, she doesn't like it if you ask her too many questions about an assignment. Don't take her class.
